content:
OUT! CAUGHT! This might cheer Potts a bit. He ends with a wicket. A slower ball, short in length around off, Romario Shepherd swings hard but cannot clear deep mid-wicket. Simple catch for Will Jacks at the mid-wicket fence. ENGLAND WIN BY 21 RUNS AND TAKE A 1-0 LEAD IN THE 3-MATCH T20I SERIES!
Romario Shepherd c W Jacks b M Potts 16 (12b 2x4 0x6)

EDGED, FOUR! That will make Potts grumpier. A full toss, outside off, Shepherd tries to slash it through the covers but gets an inside edge which rockets past the off stump and short fine leg, to the fence behind. Harry Brook tries to cheer his bowler but Potts is fuming right now.
WIDE. Potts is just not happy. Shepherd has his right foot on the off stump and Potts tries to bowl it wide outside off. Grazes the wide line and it is wided.
A length ball, outside off, Romario Shepherd lofts this wide of long off. Ben Duckett comes around from long off to his left and cuts it off. Two runs taken.
A short ball, pulled down to long on for a single.
WIDE. Potts tries to stay away from the arc of the batter and delivers it miles outside off. Left alone.
FOUR! MURDERED! Full, outside off, Holder hammers this straight back past the bowler to the long off fence.
WIDE. A slower ball, short in length, outside off, Jason Holder looks to cut but misses.
A full toss, swung towards deep mid-wicket for a single.
FOUR! Misdirected ball. Full and down the leg side, Jason Holder tickles it to the fine leg fence. 11 from the over, Brydon Carse finishes with figures of 4-0-29-0.
A short ball again. Jason looks to pull as the ball pitches and swerves away from him. Misses.
Another short ball, Holder swings but misses. Check with the square leg umpire for the height for a wide but is deemed fine.
Following the batter down the leg side, pummeled through mid on for a couple.
Fuller ball now, on middle, Shepherd swings hard and gets it of fthe inner half of the bat through mid-wicket. Single taken.
EDGED, FOUR! A short ball, around off, Romario Shepherd goes for the pull but gets a top edge, which flies over the keeper to the fine leg fence.
Full and wide outside off, RS squeezes this through the covers for one.
Full, outside off, driven down to long off for another single. 49 more needed from 13 balls.
Short, outside off, cut through point for one.

WIDE. England are not happy again. A slower ball, 109 kph, short in length, outside off, Romario looks to pull but misses. Both Potts and Buttler seem miffed, because Shepherd seemed to have gone across his stumps and the ball just grazed the wide line.
Slower ball, outside off, fuller in length, Holder stays deep in his crease and punches it down to long off for one.
Another short and wide ball outside off, this time Shepherd slaps it through cover for a run.

WIDE! A short ball, outside off, Romario Shepherd slashes but misses. Potts is not happy with the decision and questions the umpire, pointing that Shepherd's back foot is outside off stump. But the decision does not change.
Full, outside off, Jason Holder powers this down to long off for a single.

Full, around off, Jason Holder stays leg side of the ball and drives it towards cover for a run. 3 runs and a wicket from the over, Jacob Bethell's bowling figures read 2-0-27-2. Much better after the 24-run opener!
Outside off, punched down to long on for a run again.
On middle and off, pushed down to long on for a single.
Similar ball, same shot, this time an excellent diving stop at backward point.
Landed outside off, pushed towards backward point.

OUT! BOWLED! Is that the game? Tossed up slowly, around middle and off, Andre Russell gets down to play a mighty slog but misses. The ball goes straight through and hits the stumps! Russell departs for 15 (13) and from 91/2, West Indies are now 130/8! Equation - 59 from 23.
Andre Russell b J Bethell 15 (13b 0x4 1x6)
Around off, another wrong 'un, pushed towards cover. 4-0-22-1 for Adil Rashid!

DECISION OVERTURNED! The googly, around off, Romario Shepherd gets down to sweep but misses and is hit on the pads. Rashid appeals for LBW and the umpire agrees. Shepherd takes the review and Ball Tracking projects it to be spinning down the leg side!

OUT! CAUGHT! Another wrong 'un, outside off, Motie jumps down the track and looks to go downtown but only skies this high in the air. Easy catch for Tom Banton at long off. Russell is not impressed with that shot. He needs someone to hang in there. Motie departs for 3 (5) and from 91/2, West Indies have slipped down to 132/7! Equation - 57 from 26.
Gudakesh Motie c T Banton b A Rashid 3 (5b 0x4 0x6)
A quick googly, skids through outside off, not picked by Gudakesh Motie who plays and misses.
Fuller, outside off, Russell looks to go big again and slices this. Gets it high in the air but luckily for him, lands well short of Ben Duckett charging in from long off. Single taken.
SIX! HUMONGOUS! Tossed up, around off, Andre Russell swings hard and pummels this over mid-wicket!
WIDE. Tight call. Tossed up, outside off, spinning away, left alone. Just about grazed the wide line.
Down the leg side, Andre misses his clip. The ball goes off his pads through fine leg. A leg bye taken.
Another bumper, outside off, Russell looks to hook but misses.
Another short ball, outside off, Andre is waiting for it and pulls it through mid-wicket. Good sliding stop by deep mid-wicket to his right. Two runs taken.
Outside off, cut through point for a run.

IN THE AIR... SAFE! A short ball, outside off, Andre Russell goes for the pull but plays it way too early. Gets a top edge which goes high in the air. Deep mid-wicket tries to settle under it but the ball swirls in the air and eventually, lands further away from him, past his dive. Single taken.
Landed outside off, steered behind point for a single.
Full, around off, watchfully defended. 9 runs and a wicket from the over, Liam Dawson finishes with bowling figures of 4-0-20-4 - his best in T20Is, his maiden 4-wicket haul.
Another arm ball, on middle, punched down to long on for a single, to get off the mark.

OUT! BOWLED! Wicket number 4 for Dawson! After two slow balls, Dawson fires in a quicker one. Right in line of the stumps and Powell is surprised by that. Stays back to work it from the crease but the ball skids through his defense and hits the stumps. Powell departs for 13 (9) and from 91/2, West Indies are 115/6! Equation - 74 from 38.
Rovman Powell b L Dawson 13 (9b 2x4 0x6)

FOUR! Nicely done. Full and straight, Powell gets down and paddles this through fine leg. Will Jacks gives it a good chase from deep backward square leg, gets to the ball, puts in a dive but makes contact with the ropes.
Outside off, pushed towards extra cover.

FOUR! A boundary after 19 balls! A quick ball, outside off, Rovman Powell goes back and opens the face of his bat to guide it between backward point and short third. The former dives to his left but the ball sneaks through. 78 more needed from 41 balls.
Full, around off, Russell slogs, but only manages a thick inside edge onto his pads.
Full, outside off, eked out through cover for one more.
Full, on middle, pushed down to long on for a run.
Outside off, squeezed through the covers for a single.
Down the leg side, clipped fine. Jos Buttler himself hares after it and prevents the boundary. Three runs taken.
Googly, turning in, defended solidly.

Full, outside off, Powell looks to lap it fine but misses and is hit on the pads. LBW appeal but the impsct was outside off. 4 runs and 2 wickets from the over, Liam Dawson's bowling figures read 3-0-11-3!
On middle, flicked to short mid-wicket.
Works it through square leg for a single.

OUT! CAUGHT! Duckett again! Full, outside off, Roston Chase leans into the shot and lofts it over mid off. But he ends up giving a simple catch to Ben Duckett at long off! West Indies are in a spiral mode now.
Roston Chase c B Duckett b L Dawson 24 (20b 2x4 1x6)
Outside off, punched through the covers for three runs.

OUT! CAUGHT! Dawson strikes on the first ball of a new spell! Tossed up nicely, outside off, Sherfane Rutherford looks to play the slog sweep but mistimes it towards wide long on. Decent catch from Ben Duckett again.
Sherfane Rutherford c B Duckett b L Dawson 2 (4b 0x4 0x6)
Outside off, reverse swept through deep third. Good effort by Ben Duckett at the fence to keep the batters to a couple.
Punched down to long on for a single.
Another googly, outside off, Rutherford pushes but misses.
Full, outside off, flicked towards mid-wicket for a run.
Outside off, pushed down to long off for a single.
On middle, punched through mid on for a single.

OUT! CAUGHT! The 24-run over ends with a wicket! Fractionally short, around off, Lewis goes back and tries to pull it over mid-wicket but is not able to get much elevation. It is flat and dipping but Brydon Carse charges across from deep mid-wicket to his right and slides across to take a spectacular catch. The 58-run stand is broken and Lewis departs for 39 (23). West Indies are 91/3 after 10 overs. Equation - 98 from 60.
Evin Lewis c B Carse b J Bethell 39 (23b 3x4 3x6)

SIX! JUST OVER! Full, outside off, Evin Lewis gets down on a knee and swings it over wide long on. Ben Duckett is stationed at the fence and tries to leap and parry it to Brydon Carse coming in from deep mid-wicket. But the ball goes through his palms into the fence.
WIDE. Slower ball, miles outside off, left alone.

FOUR! This is dropped short now. Lewis goes back and hammers it between deep square leg and deep mid-wicket. Lands in between them and just in front of the ropes. The third umpire checks whether the ball landed inside the ropes or on the ropes and rules in favour of the bowling side.
SIX! IMPERIOUS! Full, outside off, Evin Lewis comes forward and hammers this straight back over the bowler, clearing long on!
Outside off, punched through mid on for a single.
FOUR! Full, on leg stump, Chase gets down and sweeps it through fine leg.
ANOTHER WIDE. Action replay of the previous delivery.
WIDE. Fired down the leg side, Roston Chase misses his sweep.
Outside off, pushed towards cover. 13 from the over.
A full toss, flicked to deep mid-wicket for a run.
A slower ball, outside off, Chase looks to cut but gets a thick inside edge onto his pads.
WIDE. A short ball, but down the leg side, Chase cannot get it away.
Slower ball, on a length, wide outside off, angling away, Evin reaches out and bunts it through the covers for a single.
FOUR! A touch too full, wide outside off, Lewis gets his bat down in time and squeezes it between short third and backward point for a boundary!
SIX! HAMMERED! A length ball, down the leg side, Evin Lewis swings it beautifully over square leg!
Outside off, squeezed behind point for a couple.
On middle and off, on a length, defended back to the bowler.
Goes for the reverse again but misses.
FOUR! Tossed up, outside off, Roston Chase leans and drives it over cover for a boundary!
Outside leg, Chase looks to play a switch hit but mistimes it back to the bowler.
On middle, helped through square leg for a single.

Full, outside off, Roston Chase looks to play the reverse sweep but misses. The keeper appeals for a caught behind but the umpire turns it down. The English contemplate about the review but don't take it.
Outside off, pushed towards the bowler.
Another terrific delivery, another wrong 'un, outside off, Lewis has a wild swing but misses. Jos Buttler cannot gather and the batters sneak in a bye.
Full and outside off, the googly, Evin Lewis goes hard on the drive but misses.
Outside off, driven through the covers for a single.
Full, on middle, swept through square leg for a single.
Full, outside off, pushed towards mid off for a run. The 9-ball over ends, resulting in 12 runs and West Indies are 44/2 after the Powerplay. England were rollicking along at 78/1 at this stage.
WIDE. Miles outside off, left alone.
This one hurries Chase on the pull, and he gloves it behind square leg for a single.
Outside off, cut back in, a push and a miss.
WIDE. Down the leg side, left alone.
Nothing on the Free Hit. A quick short ball, punched towards cover.

SIX! A short ball, around middle and leg, Roston Chase picks it up and pulls it massively over mid-wicket! Oh wait. The umpire spots three fielders behind square on the leg side and this will be a NO BALL! Free Hit coming up!

OUT! CAUGHT! The debutant strikes on his second ball. A short ball, at the stumps, Shai Hope tries to pull but the ball hits the toe end of his bat. Lobs tamely to the right of mid on where Ben Duckett takes simple catch. Hope departs for 3 (7) and West Indies are 33/2 after 5.2 overs. Equation - 156 from 88.
Shai Hope (c) c B Duckett b M Potts 3 (7b 0x4 0x6)
Full, outside off, driven towards mid off for a single.

Review lost for England. A short ball, outside off, Shai Hope backs away and slashes hard but misses. Jos Buttler collects and throws the ball in the air and Carse kind of joins in. Brook has a look at his keeper and takes the review. Nothing on UltraEdge as ball goes past the bat.
Another slower short ball, pulled through square leg for a single.
A slower ball, short of a length, outside leg, 120 kph, Evin Lewis looks to pull but is early and misses. Gets hit on the thigh pad.
Full and straight, Shai Hope pushes it towards mid on for a single.
Around off, just fractionally short of a length, punched back to the bowler.
Full, outside off, driven straight to cover-point.
Around off, punched towards mid on for a quick run. 3 runs and a wicket from the over, Liam Dawson's figures read 2-0-7-1 so far.
On middle and leg, tucked through square leg for a run.
On middle, pushed towards cover.
On middle, worked through wide mid on for a single.

OUT! STUMPED! The wily old fox does it again. He has been in terrific form in the past 12 months, doing well as recently as the SA20. Flights this one outside off and entices the batter. Charles jumps out but Dawson smartly slows his pace down. Tosses it a bit wider outside off as well, which means Johnson has to reach out for the ball too. He is not to the pitch of the ball and swings wildly, only to miss. Easy stumping for Jos Buttler. Charles departs for 18 (15) and West Indies are 27/1 after 3.2 overs. Equation - 162 from 100.
Johnson Charles st J Buttler b L Dawson 18 (15b 2x4 1x6)
On middle and leg, Johnson Charles looks to flick but misses and is hit on the pads.

FOUR! 12 from the over, 23 in the last 2! Tossed up, outside off, Evin Lewis leans and lofts it over cover. Jacob Bethell gives it a good chase to his right from long off and gets there. However, while trying to push the ball back, it rolls back into the ropes.
WIDE. Fired down the leg side, Lewis misses his sweep.
Down the leg side, punched down to long on for a run.
FOUR! Great shot. A touch short, outside off, Johnson Charles goes back and punches it through the covers for a boundary.
Around off, pushed straight to short mid-wicket.
Outside off, punched through the covers for a single.
WIDE. Full and down the leg side, Evin Lewis gets across to sweep but misses.
Outside off, punched towards cover.
A slower ball, on a length, outside off, Charles swishes but misses.
SIX! The first one of the chase! A length ball, at the body, Johnson Charles swivels and pulls it way over the square leg fence!
Short, outside off, JC looks to cut but misses again.
A short ball now, Johnson looks to pull but misses.
WIDE. Slower ball, well outside off, left alone.
A quick ball, around middle and leg, Charles looks to pull but misses and wears it on his body.
FOUR! Dragged away! First boundary of the run chase. A length ball, around middle and leg, cramping Charles for room. He swings hard and gets it off the inner half of the bat, through fine leg.
Full, around middle, slogged towards mid-wicket. Three runs taken.
Around off, pushed towards the bowler.
A short ball, around middle, Charles looks to tuck it away but gets a bottom edge onto his feet.
Outside off, pushed towards the bowler.
On middle, worked through square leg for a single.
Full, on middle, flicked towards square leg.

OUT! JACKS IS RUN OUT! A low full toss, around off, Jacks heaves it towards long on. He is always searching for two and Bethell responds pretty well. However, the fielder at long on, Andre Russell, goes for the tougher option and throws the ball to the keeper, Shai Hope. He collects and whips the bails off, celebrating immediately,. The run out appeal is referred upstairs and the first replay shows that Jacks is well short. ENGLAND FINISH ON 188/6!
Will Jacks run out (Andre Russell / Shai Hope) 9 (6b 1x4 0x6)
A good bumper, around off, Will Jacks looks to hook but misses.
A slower ball, on a length, outside off, Jacob Bethell slices it behind point for a run.
Jumps out of the crease and Holder pulls his length back. Jacks is cramped for room and mistimes his pull through mid on, for a single.
Slower ball, into the surface, swung towards long on for a couple. Holder is frustrated as that was not far from the fielder. Should not have been two.
EDGED, FOUR! Full and straight, Will Jacks swings hard but only manages to get it off the inner half of the bat. However, it scurries through fine leg to meet the fence!
Another yorker, on middle, clipped through mid-wicket for a couple. 11 runs and a wicket from the over, Alzarri Joseph finishes with figures of 4-0-51-1.
Around off, worked through mid-wicket for a single.

OUT! LBW! Buttler has reviewed it but one feels he knows it is in vain. After a series of slow balls, Alzarri has been mixing it up nicely in this over. Bowls a quick delivery, landing it on a length outside off and makes it to skid through. Buttler is not quite prepared for the pacy delivery and is late to get his bat down to try and nudge the ball fine, but misses it and wears it on his pads. A confident Alzarri appeals and the umpire raises his finger in a flash, much to the collective groans from the whole of Durham, one feels. The review does not halp Buttler as Ball Tracking returns two reds, with the hitting projected to be umpire's call, meaning the decision will stay. So the second T20I century will have to wait as Jos Buttler departs for a fantastic 96 (59). The 60-run stand is broken and England are 176/5 after 18.4 overs.
Jos Buttler (wk) lbw A Joseph 96 (59b 6x4 4x6)
Terrific yorker, at the base of leg stump. Jacob Bethell watches it carefully and digs it out towards mid on, off balance, for a run.
At the stumps now, worked wide of long on for a single. Moves to 96 (58).
ANOTHER WIDE. A touch harsh, perhaps? Jos moves across and Alzarri bowls it wider outside off. Buttler tries the reverse scoop but misses. The umpire has wided it but West Indies are not too happy.
WIDE. Miles outside off, Buttler tries to reach out and carve it away but misses.

EDGED, FOUR! Pace on, for a change, full and wide outside off, Jos Buttler throws his bat at it and gets a healthy outside edge. But with deep third inside the circle, the edge flies past the fielder, to his left, into the deep third fence!
Slower ball again, on a length, outside off, Jos Buttler cuts it to the left of short cover for one.

Jos Buttler agains skips down the track, seeing it, Romario Shepherd bowls a slower bouncer, Jos Buttler plays the tennis smash as he manages to get some bat on the high ball. He hits it to the right of Romario, and calls for two. Romario Shepherd runs behind the ball and cuts it off.

Length ball, pace off, on off, Jos Buttler comes down the track, and looks to go aerial, but he mistimes it altogether as the ball hits the bottom off the bat and goes to the left of long off. The batters are quick to complete two runs.

FOUR! Skillful shot! Another off cutter, on a length outside off, Buttler is prepared for the slower ball, makes up his mind, picks it from a length and reverse scoops it over short third! This is now Buttler's highest T20I score at home, going past his 84 against Pakistan in Birmingham, 2024.
Jos Buttler jumps down the track but Shepherd spots him pretty early. Bowls a slower ball down the leg side and Buttler clips it through mid-wicket. Vacant spaces out there and an easy two results.
A full toss, around off, Jacob Bethell slaps it towards wide long off for a single.

FOUR! Jos Buttler at his best! This is a length ball wide outside off, Jos Buttler walks across a bit and pulls it square of the wicket, wide of short square leg, as he finds the gap to perfection to get a boundary.

Full on off. With deep third inside the circle, Jos Buttler goes for the reverse scoop, but Jason Holder doesn't give him the pace to get it over Andre Russell at short third, as Jos Buttler mistimes the reverse scoop, which lands short of Andre Russell who runs in front and fails to stop it on the bounce. Batters complete two.
Slower deliver outside off, Jacob Bethell plays the cut wide of short cover, towards deep extra cover for a single. 150 UP FOR ENGLAND. 20 balls left.
A short ball, wide outside off, Jacob Bethell charges down the track and slashes hard but misses.
Excellent bowling. Holder sees Buttler move across and bowls it wide outside off. Buttler can only push it towards long off for a single.

A slower ball, on a length outside off, or so it seemed. The speed gun has recorded it as 130 kph and that's more or less the average speed of Jason Holder these days. Jos Buttler is a bit too eager to punish it and mistimes his punch towards cover, playing a bit too early.
Length ball, angled in on leg stump, Jos Buttler looks to flick it and misses as the ball hits his back pad and goes into the leg side. Batters sneak in a leg bye.
Again the pace off delivery, on  a length, outside off, Jacob Bethell cuts it behind square to the right of deep backward point for a single.
Fuller in length, off cutter, well outside off, Jacob Bethell goes for the reverse scoop but doesn't get any bat on it.
And now, this one, which is actually wider than the previous one, is not wided! A toch short, wide outside off, Jacob stands in his crease and attempts a flat-footed cut but misses.
ANOTHER WIDE. Sees Bethell charge out of the crease and delivers an off cutter, which lands on a length outside off, and just about grazes the wide line. A harsh call from umpire Michael Gough.
WIDE. Joseph tries to get the ball away from the hitting arc of Bethell, but gets it too wide outside off. Left alone.

SIX! Too straight and predictably, the cutter, short of a length, Bethell is expecting the length and pace, waiting for the ball to arrive. Picks the length, shuffles across and pull-helps it over backward square leg! His first boundary of the game.
A length ball, around off, Jacob Bethell steers it behind point for a couple.
Full toss on middle, Jacob Bethell plays the flick towards deep mid-wicket for a single.

Length ball, outside off, change in pace there from Romario Shepherd as he rolled his fingers over that one. Jacob Bethell goes for the cut, but gets an under edge on it, as the ball goes on the bounce to the wicket-keeper.
Romario Shepherd nails the yorker on off stump. Jacob Bethell digs it out as he pushes it back to the bowler.

The periscope! Smiles all around. Another slower-ball bumper, Jacob is caught in two minds, whether to play the pull or duck. Eventually, he does both, with his bat hanging in the air like a periscope. The ball hits the face of the bat and flies through mid-wicket. Shepherd himself runs to his left to stop the ball but still, the batters complete two runs!
Another off cutter, this time around off, angling away, Bethell is months early into the pull and misses.
An off cutter to begin. Short in length, around leg stump, Jacob Bethell swivels for the pull but does not quite get the pace of the delivery. Drags it through mid-wicket for a single.

Tossed up on middle, Jacob Bethell looks to flick it and is beaten by the spin and drift, as the ball drifts in and turns away to take the leading edge as it goes in the air just wide of the short cover. Single taken.
Short on off, Jacob Bethell punches it straight to short cover.
A touch shorter on middle leg, Jos Buttler gently pushes it into the leg side where there's no short mid-wicket and hence  the bowler goes running at it. Single taken.

SIX! FETCH THAT! A boundary after 25 balls! Flighted, around leg stump, Jos Buttler backs away to the leg side, gets under the ball and swings it cleanly over long on for his 4th biggie! Moves to 72 (45).
Full, around off, Jacob Bethell leans and drives it towards long off for a run.
A low full toss, from around the wicket, Jos Buttler whips it towards long on for a single.
Tossed up on off, Jos Buttler drives it off the front foot to long off for a single to keep the strike.
A touch full on off, Jos Buttler plays a push drive to the left of short cover, who misfields it as the ball goes to the left of long off. Batters take two runs.
From round the wicket to the left hander, shorter on middle, Jacob Bethell punches it off the back foot to the left of long on for a single.
This time Buttler changes his shot and punches this down the ground towards long off for a single.
Similar ball, same shot, same result.
Bowled with a bit of a round arm, around leg stump, from around the wicket, Jos Buttler stays leg side of the ball and pushes it towards short extra cover.
Full on off, Jacob Bethell drives it off the front foot to mid off. No run.
Andre Russell welcomes Jacob Bethell with a short ball on off, as he bangs it into the surface. Jacob Bethell leaves it alone.

OUT! LBW! Appeal and given! Tom Banton reviews it straightaway! Length ball on middle, angled into the right hander, Tom Banton looks to flick it but is beaten by pace a bit as the ball skidded off the surface and thrashed into Tom Banton's pads. Here's the UltraEdge on screen. Nothing on UltraEdge as the ball goes past the bat. Ball Tracking coming up. Pitching outside off, Impact in line, Umpire's call on hitting the stumps. The on field call stays and Banton has to go. Andre Russell has his first!
Tom Banton lbw A Russell 3 (4b 0x4 0x6)
On middle, pushed down to long on for one.

Oh dear. That could have been horrible. Excellent fielding in the end. Buttler worked this through square leg and two fielders converged on the ball - Sherfane Rutherford from deep mid-wicket and Rovman Powell from deep square leg. But just at the point when Rutherford tumbled across to his right to stop the ball, he slipped and missed the ball. However, Powell kept his eyes on the ball and stopped it just before it could touch the ropes, overrunning Rutherford. Two runs taken and both fielders smile.
An off cutter, on a length, around leg stump, Jos Buttler charges down the track and swishes hard but misses. The ball just about misses leg stump.
Tossed up, a touch slower through the air, full, on leg, Jos Buttler drives it past the bowler, to long off and the batters take a single.
Slower and shorter, turning away a little, outside off, Tom Banton flat bats it along the ground to deep mid-wicket for a single.
A touch shorter and flatter on middle, Jos Buttler works it off the back foot to deep mid-wicket. Single taken.
Delivered with a bit of round-arm action, around middle and leg, Jos pushes it with soft hands through mid on, takes the fielders on and charges back for the second.
Full, around middle and leg, following the batter down the leg side, Buttler creams the drive but finds Andre Russell at extra cover.
The arm ball, outside off, Jos Buttler goes back and punches it towards cover.
Full and straight, 93 kph, Buttler works it towards deep mid-wicket for one more. 9 runs and a wicket from Chase's opener.
Quicker through the air, 94 kph, around middle, Banton pushes it through square leg and takes another single.
Plenty of flight, around leg stump, nudged through mid-wicket for one more.
Down the leg side, Tom Banton works it through mid-wicket for a single.

OUT! BOWLED! Well, Hosein may not be playing here but spin is still Brook's achilles heel! A bit of an overambitious shot. Chase spots Brook backing down the leg side and slows down the pace of the ball, giving it plenty of air, from around the wicket, around leg stump. Brook is a long way from the stumps, in an attempt to play the inside-out shot over cover but is beaten by the lack of pace. The ball goes on with the angle and hits the stumps. That's a giveaway from Brook but that's the way this generation prefers to play. Brook departs for 6 (5) and from 95/1, England are 104/3.
Harry Brook (c) b R Chase 6 (5b 1x4 0x6)

FOUR! FEROCIOUS! Kevin Pietersen against Scott Styris, anyone? Full, from around the wicket, outside leg, Harry Brook brings out the reverse but does not quite change his grip. So cannot call it a switch hit. Slaps it well over cover for a boundary.
WIDE. 100 UP FOR ENGLAND. Fired down the leg side, left alone.
Quicker through the air, 104 kph, a full toss outside off. Jos throws the kitchen sink at it but only manages a thick outside edge to short third. Is a bit frustrated with himself, is Buttler.
Full and flighted, around off, Brook wrists it towards long on for one.
Slower ball, down the leg side, Jos Buttler nudges it towards short mid-wicket for a quick single.
Around off, Harry Brook goes back and works it through mid-wicket for a run.
Outside off, pushed towards cover.
Full, on middle, pushed down to long on for a single.

OUT! CAUGHT! Midas does it again for West Indies! This guy just has a knack of picking up wickets. Gets his second scalp in as many overs and the 79-run stand has been broken. A slower ball, outside off, short in length, Jamie Smith picks the length in a trice and pulls it extremely hard and well. But unfortunately for him, he picks the only man in the deep in front of square on the leg side and Sherfane Rutherford makes no mistake! Smith departs for 38 (20) and England are 95/2 after 8 overs.
Jamie Smith c S Rutherford b R Shepherd 38 (20b 4x4 2x6)

27TH T20I 50 FOR JOS BUTTLER! It has come off just 25 balls. Barring the last few innings, Buttler had some tremendous form in the IPL and it has followed him back home. Gets there with a push through cover for a run.
A slower ball, short in length, outside off, Jamie pulls it down to long on for one.
FOUR! Hit really hard! Plenty of width on the off side, short in length, Jamie Smith slaps a punch through the covers and despite a sweeper present, the ball races away!
A short ball now, outside off, carved away through the covers for a couple.
Slower ball, on a length outside off, 102 kph, Buttler walks down the track, getting across and works it through mid-wicket for a single.
WIDE. A slower bumper, outside off, Jos Buttler leaps and looks to play the upper cut but misses. Wided for height. The stand moves to 70 (34).
Arrowed down the leg side, Buttler works it to deep mid-wicket for one more.
Flighted, around middle, 88 kph, Smith jumps down the track and eases this to long on for a run.
Fired down the leg side, Jos Buttler tickles it through fine leg but Alzarri Joseph at short fine leg does well to get down to his right and stop it.
Outside off, driven wide of Rovman Powell at wide long off, to his left, for a couple.
On middle and leg, worked through mid-wicket for a run. Moves to 30 (15).
Full, on middle, drilled down to long on for a single.
Follows the batter down the leg side and Jamie Smith tries to flick but gets nutmegged. The ball goes through to the keeper, 23 from the over and the Powerplay yields 78/1 for England!
Comes down the track and swings hard again. Is defeated by the change in pace and drags it through mid-wicket for a single.

SIX! Even better! A full toss now, on middle, but Buttler repeats the previous ball's dose. Gets across, does not have to bend as much as the previous ball and scoops it all the way over fine leg! 22 from the over already and this stand is now worth 61 (26). And Buttler has scored 42 (18) of those!
FOUR! Innovative! Full and straight, slower in pace, Jos Buttler gets across, is low and scoops it over short fine leg!

SIX MORE! The ball keeps travelling and the 50-RUN STAND IS UP, IN 24 BALLS! This is not a slower ball but Buttler does not care. Jumps out of the crease again and swings it over mid-wicket for another half a dozen! Moves to 32 (16) with his second six.
SIX! CREAMED! A slower ball alright, but short in length. Jos Buttler charges down the track and swings it cleanly over wide mid on! The stand moves to 45 (23).
SIX! CLUBBED! Length ball on off stump, Jamie Smith swings through the line, and hits it over mid on for a big six.

Andre Russell goes for the yorker and ends up bowling a low full-toss outside off, Buttler backs away and makes some room to hit it over mid off, but he toe-ends as the ball goes towards mid off. Single taken.
Short ball, with change of pace, it is the pace off delivery, outside off, Smith backs away and doesn't time the cut as it goes to the left of short cover for a single.
Andre Russell nails the yorker and fires it on leg stump, Jamie Smith looks to flick it as the ball hits his pad and goes back towards the keeper.

SIX! Terrific shot. On a length, around middle and off, Jamie Smith swings it cleanly over mid on. It goes all the way! Hang on, the third umpire informs the on-field umpire that Russell has overstepped and will have to redeliver! NO BALL!
A slower ball now, swung over mid-wicket. Good work from Romario Shepherd, chasing the ball and getting there, pulling it back just inside the ropes. Three runs taken.

FOUR! Good ball, but what a terrific shot. Jos Buttler pre-meditates to play the reverse scoop and Andre Russell fires it full and straight. But Buttler picks the length and reverse scoops it over short third for a boundary!
Again the slower ball, Jamie Smith makes some room and drives it straight to mid off.
Full on middle, Jos Buttler flicks it to the right of mid on for a single.

Pace off from Jason Holder, it is the off cutter which lands on a length and bounces a bit extra. Jos Buttler charges down the track and goes for the pull, but perhaps gets deceived by the change of pace and misses the pull.

Pace off from Jason Holder, it is the off cutter which lands on a length and bounces a bit extra. Jamie Smith charges down the track and goes for the pull, and hits it to the right of short mid-wicket for a single.
Full and straight, Jos pushes it towards mid on for a quick run.
WIDE. Little bit of swing, but misdirected. Full and down the leg side to start, goes further away after pitching, beating Buttler's flick. Good take by the keeper, Shai Hope, diving to his left.
A short ball, outside off, Jamie Smith goes for the pull but ends up dragging it through mid-wicket for a single.

Another good length ball on off, Jos Buttler lofts this one over short extra cover, and gets enough on it to clear the inner ring. The short cover fielder runs behind it and cuts it off. Batters complete two runs.
Length ball, well outside off, Jos Buttler looks to pull it, but doesn't get any bat on it. Perhaps out of his reach and the ball was not short enough to pull either.

Full and wide outside off, Jamie Smith crouches a bit and reaches out for it, as he chips it just over short cover. He didn't middle that one, did Jamie Smith, but got enough on it to get it over short cover. Single taken.
A short ball, outside off, good height, Jos leaps and plays a forehand tennis shot which lands just wide of mid on, to his right. A single taken.

Hits the deck hard, on a length, outside off and gets it to nip back in. Buttler goes for the pull but is beaten by pace and is hit on the thigh pads. The ball goes off the pads towards deep third and the batters return for the second. No leg byes signalled, so must have been an inside edge.
On a length, around off, Jos Buttler pushes it towards cover.

Length ball outside off, width on offer, Jos Buttler cuts it square of the wicket, to deep point for a single to keep the strike. Decent start from Romario Shepherd. A wicket and 6 runs from that over.
Length ball, with a hint of shape into the right hander, on middle off, Jos Buttler pushes it to mid off.
FOUR! Jos Buttler is off and running! Overpitched on middle, Jos Buttler tonks it over the bowler's head for a one-bounce boundary.
Full and sliding well down leg, Jos Buttler looks to flick it fine, but doesn't get any bat on it. Wide given.

OUT! CAUGHT! There goes the first one! Well, if his delivery to dismiss Shreyas Iyer in the 2025 IPL final was a great one, this is none less. Slower delivery, rolling his fingers over the ball, landing it on a fuller length on middle, Ben Duckett looks to flick but is early into the shot. Gets a leading edge which goes high in the air. Three fielders converge towards the ball but eventually, the keeper, Shai Hope, calls for it and takes the catch. Duckett departs for 1 (4) and England are 16/1 after 1.3 overs!
Ben Duckett c S Hope b R Shepherd 1 (4b 0x4 0x6)
Slower ball, outside off, on a length, Duckett hits it towards mid off.
Full and wide outside off, Ben Duckett slaps it hard and hits it aerially. Lands just in front of Sherfane Rutherford at cover. Stings the fielder hard.

FOUR! Jamie Smith is on the charge! Jamie Smith comes down the track, seeing that, Jason Holder dragged his length back a bit, the line was on middle, but that didn't stop Jamie Smith from going through the shot as he swings through the line and hits it straight down the ground, to the left of mid on for four. 16 from the opening over!
Length ball on middle, Ben Duckett works it along the ground to deep square leg for a single.

A touch fuller, sliding down leg, Ben Duckett looks to tickle it fine but doesn't get any bat on it. A bit of an appeal from the keeper for caught behind, but the umpire is unmoved. Wide given. There was a sound as the ball went past Ben Duckett, and yes the ball did hit his pads as it went towards the keeper. But the umpire didn't notice it.
Length ball, on middle, Jamie Smith flicks it along the ground to deep mid-wicket for a single.
FOUR! Up and over! Overpitched, on middle and leg, Jamie Smith just flicks this casually over mid-wicket and the ball lands just inside the ropes!
WIDE. Radar lost. Full and down the leg side, Smith gets down to sweep but misses.
FOUR! Lovely shot. Jumps out of the crease, does Smith, takes the big man on, gets to the pitch of the ball and drives it sweetly through mid off for the first boundary and runs of the match.
Full, around middle and leg, Smith swings but misses and is hit on the pads.
